Articles.Content:
Hi all. So I've been playing the Little Green Men From Mars mod which is in essence RSS but without RO where the KSC has been moved to Mars. I've been trying to land on Phobos and actually found it harder than I first thought but tonight I did it so I thought I would share with you Jeb's view of Mars from Phobos. I thought it was great when I switched on his helmet lights and saw his landers reflection in the visor  

Hope you enjoy the view......

By the way the gravity is almost non-existent there so I dare not move too far or quick. Time to get back in the lander.....carefully!

EDIT: Not sure why the picture is so dark on my tablet. Its fine on my PC?

Edited March 1, 2016 by maceemiller

Congrats! The view of Mars from Phobos is an absolutely awesome sight.

Take care going home, landing on Mars is hard. Bleed off as much speed as you can before getting anywhere near the surface.

Yes, I too have had problems with pictures that are fine on PC (or Mac), and very dark on mobile devices. Don't know if it's Imgur, the forum, or something else...

Did you really need a lander that big? I mean, it's Phobos. You had 235 units of fuel in that thing when you first started the engines. Is that for redundancy? Good idea. What does the surface look like in the day?

2 hours ago, Findthepin1 said:

Did you really need a lander that big? I mean, it's Phobos. You had 235 units of fuel in that thing when you first started the engines. Is that for redundancy? Good idea. What does the surface look like in the day?

Yeah, I went prepared! Im only a sandbox player so efficiency isnt my main concern however it is too big i agree. Anyway, in daylight it looks, a tan-ish colour. I must try to explore a little
